title: Is it me or is matchmaking broken?

embed.description: Gyazo lets you instantly grab the screen and upload the image/GIF to the web. You can easily share them on Chat, Twitter, Blog, Tumblr, etc. Available for Windows, Mac and Linux.

body: I've noticed lately that EVERY Norms game has crazy differences in the player ranks. To be fair it's THAT important in Norms, but does the system think it's alright to pair Unranked/Bronze/Silver players with Plats and Diamonds? I've included a picture showing some of my recent matches but this happens all the time. I know Oce has less players but... come on... you telling me there's no other Silver players looking for a match?

replies.body:
Here we go again with the same post for the millionth time, two things one normal matchmaking is different from ranked and secondly there is almost always a premade in normals which will will obviously make the teams unbalanced.

Why is google.com so hard for people to use? Instead we get people that just post the same dumb thread that's been posted a million times already when a simple google search will give you the answer.
I tried to find an answer but nothing came up. Good try though

Oh really? Then explain this, clearly you didn't search at all.

http://lmgtfy.com/?q=league+of+legends+matchmaking
Their normals MMR is the same as yours.
Most of these people have 800+ wins on their account. I only have 170 so I REALLY doubt they have the same MMR as me.

After 100 or so wins, your MMR should be fairly stable. Unless you get crazy good overnight or something.
Someone with 800 wins might have more experience, but it doesn't mean they are better. Also high ranked players usually don't try as hard when playing with friends in normals.

Norms are all crazy with matchmaking because high elo players usually have the same norm MMR and gold and below because they don't really play as much normal games.

The other problem is, like you mentioned, that OCE has a teeny tiny player base.

http://puu.sh/h21TL/2039c0671d.jpg

I'd say theres something funny with URF.

At a low amount of wins your elo can change erratically putting you in higher games just because of one win streak. I'd say most of these games are matched as best they can for the players queuing at the time (low pop server factor). The last game you had a 4 man on your team with a 5 man premade on the other side, with premades the matchmaking can be wild as most of the time it tries to find a similar amount of premade players for the other team. Also the premade on your side could have won a few in a row, conversely the other team may have lost a lot of games in a row.
I bet you're right. I think matchmaking just throws you with a random team without checking the MMR (although some games like the 4th one I linked are a bit suspect)
Norms is separate from ranked, most people who play ranked don't touch norms.
